main event: A UFO sighting was reported by at least 25 residents in Cincinnati, Ohio on June 24, 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed for 15 seconds and the case was concluded to be an astronomical event.
The object changed color from yellow-white to brilliant red and then to brilliant blue, and seemed to come over the observer to a distance of about 900 yards.

The object made a very gradual climb, accompanied by a whining noise which seemed to increase in intensity as it climbed, and appeared to be tilted off balance and go into a slight wobble as it moved away.
The witness, who was driving a car at the time, is considered to be of sound mind and reliable.
The object was described as bright, roughly circular, and several times the size of a star, and it disappeared from view after a few minutes of observation.
sighted object: bright, roughly circular object several times the size of a star
